metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1819 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The _xfs_buf_find function in fs/xfs/xfs_buf.c in the Linux kernel before 3.7.6 does not validate block numbers, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging the ability to mount an XFS filesystem containing a metadata inode with an invalid extent map. A failure to validate block numbers was discovered in the Linux kernel's implementation of the XFS filesystem. A local user can cause a denial of service (system crash) if they can mount, or cause to be mounted a corrupted or special crafted XFS filesystem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

notes.Note: henrix> This CVE has minor impact as it requires root privileges to mount a corrupted image.  Also, it is too risky to backport the fix to older kernels (Precise, in this case). jjohansen> precise_linux and precise_linux-lts-quantal ignored (was in USN-1968-1/3.2.0-54.82 reverted minor priority CVE with high risk of regression in backport) precise_linux-armadaxp ignored due to high risk of regression in backport

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
